result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon Joseph Teasdale was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
***Per Request and Order to Correct Clerical Error in Judgment of Conviction dated 5-2-16; correct restitution surcharges as follows:
10% surcharge was added as $566.88 - corrected to $515.35
5% surcharge was added as $321.78; corrected to $293.44
**Per Court (10-27-15).  Payable out of 25% of inmate funds while incarcerated, balance as a condition of community supervision.**
Pay remainder of restitution that has not been paid while incarcerated.
No possession or consumption of illegal drugs or prescriptions.  All prescriptions must be approved by agent.
Complete all counseling, assessments, and follow through as recommended by the agent.  Full-time employment.  Court remits fines and costs.
Submit DNA sample and pay $200 surcharge.
